creator: chaitanya.jasty@gmail.com
text:
When the user initiate a transaction by clicking on "transmit" button, webserver access log shows multiple calls for the same single request.

Once the user clicks on Application UI , request will be forwarded to a load balancer, which will redirect the request to webserver, which will be sent to application server(websphere) subsequently.


access Log Format:
LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b %{JSESSIONID}C %v TIME:%D" common 

Example:
10.135.xx.xx - - [21/Aug/2016:10:16:13 +0300] "POST /XXX/scrnxxx.action HTTP/1.1" 200 12447 000099rQZYh9Cq3rmupd5xbbZRH:19m7pbpos xxx.com TIME:2287948
10.135.xx.xx - - [21/Aug/2016:10:17:32 +0300] "POST /XXX/scrnxxx.action HTTP/1.1" 200 2947 000099rQZYh9Cq3rmupd5xbbZRH:19m7pbpos xxx.com TIME:2195823
10.135.xx.xx - - [21/Aug/2016:10:17:34 +0300] "POST /XXX/scrnxxx.action HTTP/1.1" 200 12479 000099rQZYh9Cq3rmupd5xbbZRH:19m7pbpos xxx.com TIME:1945595

Observation: This is happening very rarely and unable to replicate in local environments.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: Bugzilla is for reporting bugs in httpd, and there is not even an implication of an httpd bug here.
